system_types.name: Process
system_types.comment: Records provenance of all data, linking the process type, responsible person or lab, protocol, dates, and the input and output objects

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for each process record (Primary key)

fields.name: process
fields.comment: Reference to the specific process type used to generate the outputs

fields.name: person
fields.comment: Reference to the person or lab that performed the process

fields.name: campaign
fields.comment: Reference to the ENIGMA campaign under which the data were generated

fields.name: protocol
fields.comment: Protocol used in this process (foreign key to Protocol.name)

fields.name: date_start
fields.comment: YYYY[-MM[-DD]]

fields.name: date_end
fields.comment: YYYY[-MM[-DD]]

fields.name: input_objects
fields.comment: List of references to data that were input to this process

fields.name: output_objects
fields.comment: List of references to data that were produced by this process

static_types.name: ENIGMA
static_types.comment: Root of all datasets in this project

static_types.name: Location
static_types.comment: Two dimensional location on Earth of a field site where samples are taken or measurements made

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the location (Primary key)

fields.name: name
fields.comment: Unique name of the location

fields.name: latitude
fields.comment: Latitude of the location in decimal degrees

fields.name: longitude
fields.comment: Longitude of the location in decimal degrees

fields.name: continent
fields.comment: Continent where the location is situated

fields.name: country
fields.comment: Country of the location

fields.name: region
fields.comment: Specific local region name(s)

fields.name: biome
fields.comment: Biome classification of the location

fields.name: feature
fields.comment: Environmental or geographic feature at the location

static_types.name: Sample
static_types.comment: A sample of material collected from a field location on which further assays or experiments are performed

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the sample (Primary key)

fields.name: name
fields.comment: Unique name of the sample

fields.name: location
fields.comment: Location where the sample was collected (Foreign key)

fields.name: depth
fields.comment: For below-ground samples, the average distance below ground level in meters where the sample was taken

fields.name: elevation
fields.comment: For above-ground samples, the average distance above ground level in meters where the sample was taken

fields.name: date
fields.comment: YYYY[-MM[-DD]]

fields.name: time
fields.comment: HH[:MM[:SS]] [AM|PM]

fields.name: timezone
fields.comment: ISO8601 compliant format, ie. UTC-7

fields.name: material
fields.comment: Material type of the sample

fields.name: env_package
fields.comment: MIxS environmental package classification of the sample

fields.name: description
fields.comment: Free-form description or notes about the sample

static_types.name: Taxon
static_types.comment: Taxonomic records, each with a unique identifier, the taxon's name, and optionally the corresponding NCBI taxonomy ID

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for a taxon record (Primary key)

fields.name: name
fields.comment: Unique taxon name, typically the scientific name

fields.name: ncbi_taxid
fields.comment: NCBI taxonomy identifier for the taxon, if available

static_types.name: OTU
static_types.comment: ASV (Amplicon Sequence Variant) or OTU (Operational Taxonomic Unit) for older datasets

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for each ASV/OTU (Primary key)

fields.name: name
fields.comment: Unique name assigned to the ASV/OTU, usually md5sum

static_types.name: Condition
static_types.comment: A field or lab condition imposed by researchers, e.g., used for isolation or growth

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the condition (Primary key)

fields.name: name
fields.comment: Unique text name describing the condition

static_types.name: Strain
static_types.comment: Microbial strain, either a possibly genetically modified lab-grown strain or one that is found in the environment

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for each strain (Primary key)

fields.name: name
fields.comment: Unique name of the strain

fields.name: description
fields.comment: Free-text description of the strain

fields.name: genome
fields.comment: Genome object for sequenced, wild type strains

fields.name: derived_from
fields.comment: Name of the parent strain from which this strain was derived, if created by genetic modification or similar process

fields.name: genes_changed
fields.comment: List of gene identifiers that have been altered in this strain, if created by genetic modification, if known

static_types.name: Community
static_types.comment: A Microbial community, either defined or containing one or more unknown microbes

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique internal identifier for the community (Primary key)

fields.name: name
fields.comment: Unique name of the community

fields.name: community_type
fields.comment: Type of community, e.g., isolate or enrichment

fields.name: sample
fields.comment: Reference to the Sample from which the community was obtained.

fields.name: parent_community
fields.comment: Reference to the name of a parent community, establishing hierarchical relationships

fields.name: condition
fields.comment: Reference to the experimental or environmental condition associated with the community

fields.name: defined_strains
fields.comment: List of strains that comprise the community, if the community is defined

fields.name: description
fields.comment: Free-text field providing additional details or notes about the community

static_types.name: Reads
static_types.comment: Reads from genome or metagenome sequencing, including count, type, technology, and related metadata

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for each reads dataset (Primary key)

fields.name: name
fields.comment: Unique name for the reads

fields.name: read_count
fields.comment: Number of reads

fields.name: read_type
fields.comment: Category of reads (e.g., single-end, paired-end)

fields.name: sequencing_technology
fields.comment: Sequencing technology used (e.g., Illumina)

fields.name: link
fields.comment: Link to the reads file (e.g., fastq)

static_types.name: Assembly
static_types.comment: A genome assembly, including only the contigs and not annotated genes

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique text identifier for the assembly (Primary key)

fields.name: name
fields.comment: Unique name for the assembly

fields.name: strain
fields.comment: Strain name from which the assembly was derived (foreign key to Strain.name).

fields.name: n_contigs
fields.comment: Number of contigs in the assembly

fields.name: link
fields.comment: Reference to the actual assembly data

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the genome (Primary key)

fields.name: name
fields.comment: Unique name of the genome

fields.name: strain
fields.comment: Name of the microbial strain associated with the genome (foreign key)

fields.name: n_contigs
fields.comment: Number of contigs in the genome assembly

fields.name: n_features
fields.comment: Number of annotated features (e.g., genes) in the genome

fields.name: link
fields.comment: Link to where the genome itself is actually stored

static_types.name: Gene
static_types.comment: Genes with genomic coordinates, identifiers, and functional annotations for each genome

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique internal identifier for the gene (Primary key)

fields.name: gene_id
fields.comment: Unique external identifier for the gene

fields.name: genome
fields.comment: Name of the genome to which the gene belongs (foreign key)

fields.name: aliases
fields.comment: List of alternative names or identifiers for the gene

fields.name: contig_number
fields.comment: Contigs are indexed starting at 1, as in KBase

fields.name: strand
fields.comment: DNA strand of the gene (+ for forward, - for reverse)

fields.name: start
fields.comment: Genomic start coordinate on the contig, indexed starting at 1 as in KBase

fields.name: stop
fields.comment: Genomic stop coordinate in base pairs

fields.name: function
fields.comment: Annotated biological function of the gene

static_types.name: Bin
static_types.comment: Binned contigs from a metagenomic assembly

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the bin (Primary key)

fields.name: name
fields.comment: Human-readable, unique name for the bin

fields.name: assembly
fields.comment: Identifier of the metagenomic assembly that the bin belongs to (foreign key to Assembly.name)

fields.name: contigs
fields.comment: Array of contig identifiers included in the bin

static_types.name: Protocol
static_types.comment: Protocol definitions used to describe experimental procedures and support provenance tracking

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the protocol (Primary key)

fields.name: name
fields.comment: Unique, human-readable name of the protocol

fields.name: description
fields.comment: Detailed description of the protocol

fields.name: link
fields.comment: URL linking to additional documentation of the protocol, such as protocols.io

static_types.name: Image
static_types.comment: File containing images or multidimensional image data

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for each image (Primary key)

fields.name: name
fields.comment: Unique name (e.g., filename) for the image.

fields.name: description
fields.comment: Textual description of the image

fields.name: MIME type
fields.comment: MIME type specifying the image file format (e.g., image/jpeg)

fields.name: size
fields.comment: File size of the image measured in bytes

fields.name: dimensions
fields.comment: Image dimensions (e.g., width Ã— height) expressed in pixels

fields.name: link
fields.comment: URL or file path linking to the stored image

static_types.name: TnSeq_Library
static_types.comment: Transposon Sequencing (TnSeq) library, including some quality metrics, metadata, and the genome used

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique TnSeq library identifier (Primary key)

fields.name: name
fields.comment: Unique, human-readable name of the TnSeq library

fields.name: genome
fields.comment: Foreign key to the associated genome (Genome.name) from which the library was derived

fields.name: primers_model
fields.comment: Type of primers used to generate the library

fields.name: n_mapped_reads
fields.comment: Number of reads that mapped to the reference genome

fields.name: n_barcodes
fields.comment: Total number of distinct barcode sequences detected in the library

fields.name: n_usable_barcodes
fields.comment: Number of barcodes deemed usable after quality filtering

fields.name: n_insertion_locations
fields.comment: Number of distinct transposon insertion sites identified in the library

fields.name: hit_rate_essential
fields.comment: Proportion of essential genes with at least one transposon insertion

fields.name: hit_rate_other
fields.comment: Proportion of non-essential (other) genes with at least one transposon insertion

static_types.name: DubSeq_Library
static_types.comment: Dual Barcoded Shotgun Expression Library Sequencing (DubSeq) library, including some quality metrics, metadata, and the genome used

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Unique DubSeq library identifier (Primary key)

fields.name: name
fields.comment: Unique, human-readable name of the DubSeq library

fields.name: genome
fields.comment: Foreign key to the associated genome (Genome.name) from which the library was derived

fields.name: n_fragments
fields.comment: Number of unique DNA fragments in the library
